Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Atom, 'process-this'-POST and rockets

Mike Schinkel wrote:

> I generally agree with you in the long term, but not in the short term. The
> market won't reward many companies fast enough, so we have the chicken & egg
> problem.  If they did reward them quickly, we'd have no problem with people
> not following standards, right?

Markets are not perfectly efficient. There's always friction. It takes 
time for the bad actors to be weeded out, but the time does pass.

When I started working with HTML it seemed like forever before people 
could use forms reliably. When I started working with CSS, it seemed 
like anything beyond a font tag would never be possible. When I started 
working with XML, I despaired of using XSLT on public facing web sites. 
All these are now reasonably reliable today; even if most developers 
still assume it's 1999 and that none of these things work. (Well, maybe 
not forms. :-) )

Funny how time passes faster as I get older. :-)

--
